intro: Hepetis platystemon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically displaying shades of pink or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
